column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: software. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```@prefix ex: <http://example.org/> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .ex:Software rdf:type rdfs:Class .ex:hasName rdf:type rdf:Property ;           rdfs:domain ex:Software ;           rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .ex:hasType rdf:type rdf:Property ;           rdfs:domain ex:Software ;           rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .ex:hasVersion rdf:type rdf:Property ;             rdfs:domain ex:Software ;             rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .ex:OpenSource rdf:type rdfs:Class ;             rdfs:subClassOf ex:Software .ex:Commercial rdf:type rdfs:Class ;             rdfs:subClassOf ex:Software .ex:Apache rdf:type ex:OpenSource ;         ex:hasName "Apache"^^xsd:string ;         ex:hasType "Server Software"^^xsd:string ;         ex:hasVersion "2.4.48"^^xsd:string .ex:MicrosoftOffice rdf:type ex:Commercial ;                  ex:hasName "Microsoft Office"^^xsd:string ;                  ex:hasType "Productivity Software"^^xsd:string ;                  ex:hasVersion "2104"^^xsd:string .```   This ontology describes software, their properties and types. It describes that software can be of two types, Open Source (e.g.Apache), or Commercial (e.g.Microsoft Office). The properties of a software that this ontology describes are its name, type, and version.
